result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.

3:29 PM Defendant Seth Lee Schumacher appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erik Johnson appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Atty Johnson will be 

Atty Juech requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.
Atty Johnson has no objection and states that he believes that the victim has moved out.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No contact with Victim 1 or her residence
*Defendant is allowed to go to residence one time with Law Enforcement with prior notice to the victim, to get his belongings.
